alert.note: Alert for Fairbanks Metro Area (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 11 at 6:34PM AKST until December 13 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches. * WHERE...Fairbanks Metro Area. * WHEN...From 9 PM this evening to 3 PM AKST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Two rounds of snowfall are expected over the next 48 hours, the first overnight into midday Tuesday, and the second Tuesday evening into Wednesday morning. The second round into Wednesday is expected to produce heavier amounts than then first wave. There may be a west to east snowfall gradient across the Fairbanks Metro Area with total accumulations of 3 to 4 inches near Ester and 4 to 6 inches near North Pole.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
